question.title: How can you set proxyName and proxyPort values in Spring Boot Application YAML for embedded tomcat instance?
question.body:
In the past, I have had to set the proxyName and proxyPort (along with scheme and secure) so that when Okta Saml SSO assertions are made/validated the correct domain values are used (since my app is running behind F5 Load balancer).

I would setup my Tomcat Connector in the Server.xml as:


<!-- proxy info is required for saml validation to work -->
    <Connector port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                proxyName="mysite.mydomain.com"
                proxyPort="443"
                scheme="https"
                secure="true" 
                connectionTimeout="60000"
                enableLookups="false"
                disableUploadTimeout="false"
                redirectPort="8443"
                maxThreads="300"
                minSpareThreads="10"
                maxPostSize="15000000"
                compression="on" compressionMinSize="2048" 
                noCompressionUserAgents="gozilla, traviata" compressableMimeType="text/html,text/xml,application/json,text/javascript" />

My latest app will be doing the same type of okta / saml login, but I was planning on using the embedded tomcat, and I am setting that up minimally using yaml config.

I have tried the following:

server:
  tomcat:
    connectors:
      - port: 8080
        proxyName: mysite.mydomain.com
        proxyPort: 443
        scheme: https
        secure: true

as well as:

server:
  port: 8080
  proxy:
    name: mysite.mydomain.com
    port: 443
  scheme: https
  secure: true

But when I debug and look at my Tomcat request, the values are not set:

I can't seem to find any good YAML documentation for these settings. Has anyone done anything like this and could let me know how the YAML should be setup for these values?
